Barbara Pravi has won Eurovision France: câ€™est vous qui dĂ©cidez, and will represent France at the 2021 Eurovision Song Contest with the song “VoilĂ ”.
Tonight, France held their selection show for Eurovision 2021, Eurovision France: câ€™est vous qui dĂ©cidez. The show was broadcast live from Paris, and featured 12 acts competing to represent France at this year’s contest. These 12 acts were:

Following the 12 performances, the top 7 scoring songs from the public vote passed through to the next round, and the jury selected one wildcard act, LMK, to join them. The 8 acts who made it through to the 2nd round of the contest were:

Following another round of voting, Barbara was declared a winner through 50% jury vote and 50% public vote, placing 1st in both. She will perform “VoilĂ ” in the grand final of Eurovision 2021, on 22 May.
Image Source: Barbara Pravi
France in the Eurovision Song Contest France was one of seven countries to participate in the first Eurovision Song Contest in 1956. Since then they have participated in every contest aside from 1974 and 1982. Their withdrawal in 1974 was caused by the death of President Georges Pompidou, while 1982â€™s withdrawal was a result of TF1 declining to enter the contest. France has won the contest on five occasions, the most recent being in 1977 when Marie Myriam performed â€śLâ€™oiseau et lâ€™enfantâ€ť. Franceâ€™s best result of the 2000s came in 2001 when Natasha St-Pier finished 4th in Copenhagen, Denmark.
